intro: Afrardisia schlechteri, commonly known as the African violets, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often cultivated for their ornamental value. The plant prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
